cmp: 家 (furniture/tool, -ist/-er/-ian/home/family/a person engaged in a certain art or profession)
mng: (of a woman) to marry, to marry off a daughter, to shift (blame etc)

exm.mng: (of a woman) to marry, to marry off a daughter, to shift (blame etc)
to graft (a branch to a rootstock)
to remarry (of widow), to pass on (blame, cost, obligation, unpleasant consequence etc), to transfer (blame, guilt), to pass the buck
to impute, to shift the blame onto someone else
If you marry a chicken, follow the chicken (idiom); A woman should follow whatever her husband orders., We must learn to accept the people around us.
lit if you marry a chicken follow the chicken, if you marry a dog follow the dog (idiom)
exm.pyn: jià jī suí jī , jià gǒu suí gǒu

exm.mng: to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others, to pass the buck
the rain will fall, the womenfolk will marry (idiom), fig. the natural order of things, something you can't go against
exm.pyn: tiān yào luò yǔ , niáng yào jià rén
